DOC.brief_title: Omega-3 Fatty Acids Treating Adults With Major Depression
DOC.detailed_description: Major depression common mental disorder affect million people year . It severely impact person 's life , cause someone often feel sad hopeless , well affect person 's sleep pattern , concentration , energy level . Despite availability numerous therapy , current treatment ideal people . Recently , research show increase dietary intake polyunsaturated fatty acid ( PUFAs ) , omega-3 fatty acid , might help treat depression . Eicosapentanoic acid ( EPA ) docosahexanoic acid ( DHA ) two common type PUFAs high omega-3 fatty acid available low dosage dietary supplement . The purpose study compare effectiveness EPA-enriched mixture versus pure DHA versus placebo treat symptom major depression . Participants double blind study randomly assign one three study group . Participants assign first study group receive capsule contain 500 mg EPA-enriched omega-3 fatty acid preparation . Participants assign second study group receive capsule contain 500 mg pure DHA . Participants assign third study group receive capsule contain placebo . The study last approximately 9 week . This include initial screen first week follow 8-week period participant take two capsule assign treatment morning . Participants attend total six study visit . The initial visit last approximately 2 hour include psychiatric assessment , urine blood collection , electrocardiogram ( EKG ) , Food Processor Questionnaire . Participants qualify participation enter 1-week washout period stop take current psychotropic medication . At second study visit , participant assign treatment group . Upon start assigned treatment , participant return study visit every 2 week report possible side effect complete standard psychiatric assessment test . All study visit take approximately 1 hour , except last , take 2 hour . In addition psychiatric assessment review side effect , final study visit also include physical exam blood collection .
